metadata.titleEn: Ground observation dataset of corn biomass, vegetation coverage, leaf area index and plant height at Daman station in the middle reaches of Heihe River (growth period in 2019)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河中游大满站玉米生物量、植被覆盖度、叶面积指数及株高地面观测数据集（2019年生长期）
metadata.description: This dataset is a continuous ground observation data of vegetation coverage (%), biomass (g/plant), leaf area index (LAI) and plant height (cm) of seed corn during the growing period in 2019 at Daman Station ( 38.85551N,100.37223E)in the middle reaches of the Heihe River. Ground observation was carried out in three sample plots.  Biomass observation included fresh and dry aboveground biomass, fresh and dry underground biomass (fresh and dry root weight), vegetation coverage was observed by digital camera, leaf area index was observed by LAI 2200, and plant height was observed by tape measure. The observation period was from May 17 to September 23, 2019, in which LAI started from June 11. Observation parameters were observed every 5 days before July 31 and every 10 days thereafter, and a total of 20 observations (LAI was 15) were carried out during the whole growing period. The dataset can provide data basis for inversion and validation of surface vegetation parameters.
metadata.descriptionCn: 本数据为黑河中游大满站（38.85551N，100.37223E）制种玉米2019年生长期的植被覆盖度（%）、生物量（克/株）、叶面积指数以及株高（厘米）的地面连续观测数据集。地面观测在3块样地开展：其中，生物量包括地上生物量鲜重和干重、地下生物量鲜重和干重（根的鲜重和干重）的观测，植被覆盖度采用数码相机拍照法进行观测，叶面积指数采用LAI 2200进行观测，株高采用卷尺进行观测。观测时间段为2019年5月17日-9月23日，其中LAI自6月11日开始，观测参数在7月31日以前每5天观测一次，7月31后每10天观测一次，整个生长期共开展了20次观测（LAI为15次）。该数据集可为地表植被参数反演和验证提供数据基础。

background: Crop biomass is one of the most important biophysical indicators of crop growth. The accurate and efficient estimation of the regional crop biomass at different growth stages is of great importance in guiding crop management decision making, such as in effective fertilization, water irrigation, weeding, and pest and disease management. In addition, as an important aspect of biomass energy, the accurate estimation of crop biomass contributes to the rational and effective utilization of biomass energy. Moreover, effective estimates of crop biomass during the growing season could play a key role in crop yield prediction. The traditional crop biomass estimation method is mainly based on field measurements, which include destructive field sampling, laboratory drying and weighting. The traditional methods are relatively accurate, but they are labor intensive and time consuming. Moreover, the sparse nature of space makes it impossible to provide a comprehensive understanding at regional or larger scales. Thus, it is impossible to acquire the regional crop biomass via ground measurements alone. The satellite remote sensing technique is a unique and useful method for crop biomass monitoring in a repeatable manner due to the valuable information it provides on vegetation parameters, high spatial coverage and long time series, which effectively compensates for the deficiency of traditional biomass estimation methods. Previous studies have revealed that remote sensing is a reliable and effective technique to obtain biophysical and biochemical crop information.
research objective: In this paper, four machine learning models, namely random forest (RF), support vector machine (SVM), artificial neural network (ANN), and extreme gradient boosting (XGBoost) were adopted to estimate the seasonal corn biomass based on field observation data and moderate resolution imaging spectroradiometer (MODIS) reflectance data from 2012 to 2019 in the middle reaches of the Heihe River basin, China.
challenges: This is currently one of the major challenges for agricultural researchers and farm managers.
methods: In this study, the corn biomass was estimated based on daily MODIS datasets with a 500 m spatial resolution combined with long-term ground observation data in the middle reaches of the Heihe River Basin, and four machine learning algorithms, namely RF, SVM, ANN, and XGBoost, were adopted to predict the biomass. Large, relatively homogeneous areas, which mainly functioned as corn growing areas, were selected as the sample sites. According to a field survey of the sample sites, a total of sixteen sites were selected in 2012, and three sites were selected for field measurement purposes every year from 2013 to 2019. One to three plots for each sample site were chosen for further biomass observation, with each plot covering an area of 100 m ×100 m. All selected plants in each plot were collected, and the roots of the corn plants were washed. The fresh weight was measured, after which the plants were transported to the laboratory, chopped into easy-to-dry segments, and dried in an oven at 85°C for 48–72 h until a constant dry biomass was obtained. MODIS MCD43A4 and MOD15A2 products from May to September from 2012 to 2019 were analyzed in this study. The forward feature selection method was implemented to choose the most influential variables, which is an iterative method starting from the condition of no model features. In each iteration, we add a given feature that best improves the model until the addition of a new variable does not further improve the model performance. The RF, SVM, ANN, and XGBoost algorithms were adopted in this study. R software was used to implement the above four machine learning algorithms with the randomForest, kernlab, brnn, and xgboost packages. In this study, the caret package in R software was applied to tune the parameters of the above four machine learning algorithms. The 10-fold cross validation method was implemented to evaluate the performance of the above four machine learning models due to the small number of training samples.
dataset: MODIS MCD43A4 and MOD15A2 products from May to September from 2012 to 2019 were analyzed in this study. A total of sixteen sites were selected in 2012, and three sites were selected for field measurement purposes every year from 2013 to 2019. One to three plots for each sample site were chosen for further biomass observation, with each plot covering an area of 100 m ×100 m.
findings: The results indicated that the corn biomass was suitably estimated (the coefficient of determination (R2) was between 0.72 and 0.78) with the four machine learning models. The XGBoost model performed better than the other three models (R2 = 0.78, root mean squared error (RMSE) = 2.86 t/ha and mean absolute error (MAE) = 1.86 t/ha). Moreover, the RF model was an effective method (R2 = 0.77, RMSE = 2.91 t/ha and MAE = 1.91 t/ha), with a performance comparable to that of the XGBoost model.
backgroundCn: 作物生物量是作物生长最重要的生物物理指标之一。在不同生长阶段准确高效地估算区域作物生物量，对于指导作物管理决策至关重要，例如有效施肥、灌溉、除草以及病虫害管理。此外，作为生物质能源的重要组成部分，准确估算作物生物量有助于生物质能源的合理和有效利用。此外，在生长季节有效估算作物生物量对作物产量预测也起着关键作用。传统的作物生物量估算方法主要基于田间测量，包括破坏性田间取样、实验室干燥和称重。传统方法相对准确，但劳动密集且耗时。此外，空间的稀疏性使得无法在区域或更大尺度上提供全面的理解。因此，仅通过地面测量无法获取区域作物生物量。卫星遥感技术是一种独特且有用的作物生物量监测方法，由于其提供的植被参数的宝贵信息、高空间覆盖率和长期时间序列，有效弥补了传统生物量估算方法的不足。以往研究表明，遥感是一种可靠且有效的技术，可以获取生物物理和生化作物信息。
research objectiveCn: 在本文中，采用了四种机器学习模型，即随机森林（RF）、支持向量机（SVM）、人工神经网络（ANN）和极端梯度提升（XGBoost），基于2012年至2019年在中国黑河中游地区的田间观测数据和中分辨率成像光谱仪（MODIS）反射率数据来估计季节性玉米生物量。
challengesCn: 这是目前农业研究人员和农场管理者面临的主要挑战之一。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，基于每日MODIS数据集（空间分辨率为500米）结合长期地面观测数据，估算了黑河中游地区的玉米生物量，并采用了四种机器学习算法，即随机森林（RF）、支持向量机（SVM）、人工神经网络（ANN）和XGBoost，来预测生物量。选择了主要作为玉米种植区的大型相对均匀区域作为样本地点。根据对样本地点的实地调查，2012年共选择了16个地点，从2013年到2019年每年选择3个地点进行实地测量。每个样本地点选择1到3个样地进行进一步的生物量观测，每个样地的面积为100米×100米。每个样地内的所有植物均被收集，玉米植物的根部被清洗。测量新鲜重量后，植物被运输到实验室，切成易于干燥的段，并在85°C的烘箱中干燥48至72小时，直到获得恒定的干生物量。本研究分析了2012年至2019年5月至9月的MODIS MCD43A4和MOD15A2产品。采用前向特征选择方法选择最具影响力的变量，该方法是一种迭代方法，从没有模型特征的条件开始。在每次迭代中，添加一个最佳改善模型的特征，直到添加新变量不再进一步改善模型性能为止。本研究中采用了RF、SVM、ANN和XGBoost算法。使用R软件实现上述四种机器学习算法，使用randomForest、kernlab、brnn和xgboost包。使用R软件中的caret包对上述四种机器学习算法的参数进行调优。由于训练样本数量较少，采用10折交叉验证方法评估上述四种机器学习模型的性能。
datasetCn: 本研究分析了2012年至2019年5月至9月的MODIS MCD43A4和MOD15A2产品。2012年选择了16个站点，从2013年到2019年每年选择3个站点进行实地测量。每个样本站点选择1到3个样地进行进一步的生物量观察，每个样地的面积为100米×100米。
findingsCn: 结果表明，玉米生物量的估计是合适的（决定系数（R2）在0.72到0.78之间），四种机器学习模型均表现良好。其中，XGBoost模型的表现优于其他三种模型（R2 = 0.78，均方根误差（RMSE）= 2.86 t/ha，平均绝对误差（MAE）= 1.86 t/ha）。此外，随机森林（RF）模型也是一种有效的方法（R2 = 0.77，RMSE = 2.91 t/ha，MAE = 1.91 t/ha），其性能与XGBoost模型相当。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to estimate crop biomass at different growth stages in the middle reaches of a river basin?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一种数据收集方法的示例，用于估计河流中游流域不同生长阶段的作物生物量？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a data collection method for estimating crop biomass involves using field measurements such as destructive field sampling, laboratory drying and weighing, combined with satellite remote sensing techniques like MODIS reflectance data to monitor crop biomass over time.
Example.AnswerCn: 估算作物生物量的数据收集方法的一个例子涉及使用田间测量，如破坏性田间取样、实验室干燥和称重，以及结合卫星遥感技术，如MODIS反射率数据，以监测作物生物量随时间的变化。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when using traditional data collection methods for crop biomass estimation?
Example.QuestionCn: 使用传统数据收集方法进行作物生物量估算时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge with traditional data collection methods for crop biomass estimation is that they are labor intensive, time consuming, and cannot provide a comprehensive understanding at regional or larger scales due to the sparse nature of space.
Example.AnswerCn: 传统的作物生物量估计数据收集方法面临的一个挑战是，它们劳动密集、耗时，并且由于空间分布稀疏，无法在区域或更大规模上提供全面的理解。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset used in machine learning models to estimate corn biomass over several years?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于机器学习模型的示例数据集，以估计多年来的玉米生物量？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a dataset used is the MODIS MCD43A4 and MOD15A2 products, which were analyzed from May to September from 2012 to 2019, in conjunction with ground observation data from selected sites in the middle reaches of the Heihe River Basin.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个使用的数据集是MODIS MCD43A4和MOD15A2产品，这些数据在2012年至2019年间的5月至9月进行了分析，并与来自黑河流域中游选定地点的地面观测数据结合使用。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of 'machine learning models' in estimating crop biomass?
Definition.QuestionCn: “机器学习模型”在估算作物生物量中的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Machine learning models, such as random forest, support vector machine, artificial neural network, and extreme gradient boosting, are used to estimate crop biomass by analyzing data from sources like remote sensing and ground observations. These models help in predicting biomass efficiently by processing and learning from large datasets, offering an alternative to traditional field measurement methods.
Definition.AnswerCn: 机器学习模型，如随机森林、支持向量机、人工神经网络和极端梯度提升，被用于通过分析遥感数据和地面观测数据来估计作物生物量。这些模型通过处理和学习大量数据集，帮助有效地预测生物量，为传统的田间测量方法提供了一种替代方案。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the ground-based observation methods for measuring corn biomass, such as destructive field sampling, compare to satellite remote sensing techniques in terms of accuracy and efficiency?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 地面观测方法（如破坏性田间取样）与卫星遥感技术在测量玉米生物量方面的准确性和效率如何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Ground-based observation methods like destructive field sampling and laboratory drying are accurate but labor-intensive and time-consuming. In contrast, satellite remote sensing provides valuable information on vegetation parameters with high spatial coverage and long time series, offering a more efficient method for monitoring crop biomass on a regional scale.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 地面观测方法如破坏性现场取样和实验室干燥虽然准确，但劳动密集且耗时。相比之下，卫星遥感能够提供关于植被参数的宝贵信息，具有高空间覆盖率和长时间序列，为区域尺度的作物生物量监测提供了一种更高效的方法。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences between using machine learning algorithms like random forest and XGBoost for estimating corn biomass compared to traditional field-based measurements?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用机器学习算法如随机森林和XGBoost来估计玉米生物量与传统的田间测量方法之间的区别是什么？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Machine learning algorithms, such as random forest and XGBoost, leverage satellite data and provide estimates with a high coefficient of determination (R2 between 0.72 and 0.78), indicating good performance. These methods offer scalability and efficiency compared to traditional field-based measurements, which are limited in spatial coverage and labor-intensive.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 机器学习算法，如随机森林和XGBoost，利用卫星数据提供估计，具有较高的决定系数（R2在0.72到0.78之间），表明其性能良好。这些方法相比传统的基于实地测量的方法，具有更好的可扩展性和效率，因为后者在空间覆盖和劳动强度上存在限制。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges of acquiring corn biomass data using traditional methods differ from those encountered when using satellite remote sensing and machine learning approaches?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 获取玉米生物量数据时，传统方法面临的挑战与使用卫星遥感和机器学习方法时遇到的挑战有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Traditional methods face challenges such as being labor-intensive, time-consuming, and limited in spatial coverage, making it difficult to obtain regional data. In contrast, satellite remote sensing and machine learning approaches provide extensive spatial coverage and leverage repeatable data collection over time, though they may require complex data processing and model tuning to ensure accuracy.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 传统方法面临着劳动密集、耗时和空间覆盖有限等挑战，使得获取区域数据变得困难。相比之下，卫星遥感和机器学习方法提供了广泛的空间覆盖，并利用可重复的数据收集，但可能需要复杂的数据处理和模型调优以确保准确性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the integration of traditional field sampling with remote sensing data enhance the accuracy and efficiency of crop biomass estimation?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 传统田间采样与遥感数据的结合如何提高作物生物量估计的准确性和效率？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration allows for the combination of detailed, accurate ground measurements with the broad spatial coverage and repeatability of remote sensing, thus compensating for the spatial limitations of traditional methods and enhancing the overall estimation process.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 该集成允许将详细、准确的地面测量与遥感的广泛空间覆盖和重复性相结合，从而弥补传统方法的空间局限性，并增强整体估计过程。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the necessity of using both ground and satellite data for crop biomass estimation in the Heihe River basin?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域进行作物生物量估算时，哪些因素促使需要同时使用地面数据和卫星数据？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The accurate estimation of crop biomass is crucial for effective crop management and biomass energy utilization. Ground measurements alone are labor-intensive, time-consuming, and cannot provide comprehensive regional understanding. Satellite remote sensing offers valuable vegetation parameters, high spatial coverage, and long time series, which effectively complement ground measurements and address the limitations of traditional biomass estimation methods.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 作物生物量的准确估计对于有效的作物管理和生物质能源利用至关重要。仅依靠地面测量不仅劳动密集、耗时，而且无法提供全面的区域理解。卫星遥感提供了有价值的植被参数、高空间覆盖率和长期时间序列，有效补充了地面测量，解决了传统生物量估计方法的局限性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why might machine learning algorithms be preferred for estimating seasonal corn biomass over traditional methods in agricultural research?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 机器学习算法在农业研究中估算季节性玉米生物量时，可能比传统方法更受青睐的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Traditional methods based on field measurements are accurate but labor-intensive and time-consuming, making them unsuitable for large-scale regional analysis. Machine learning algorithms, combined with satellite data, provide a more efficient and scalable approach to estimate biomass at different growth stages, offering improved model performance and enabling effective regional crop management.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 基于实地测量的传统方法虽然准确，但劳动密集且耗时，因而不适合大规模区域分析。结合卫星数据的机器学习算法提供了一种更高效、可扩展的方法来估算不同生长阶段的生物量，提升了模型性能，并促进了有效的区域作物管理。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in obtaining accurate regional crop biomass estimates in agricultural research?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在农业研究中，获取准确的区域作物生物量估计面临的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: One major challenge is the sparse nature of ground measurements, which makes it difficult to provide a comprehensive understanding at regional or larger scales. Additionally, the labor-intensive nature of field sampling and the need for long-term observation data pose significant hurdles. Satellite remote sensing and machine learning techniques are used to address these challenges by providing repeatable, large-scale data and efficient estimation methods.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 一个主要挑战是地面测量的稀疏性，这使得在区域或更大尺度上提供全面理解变得困难。此外，现场采样的劳动密集型特性和对长期观测数据的需求也构成了重大障碍。卫星遥感和机器学习技术被用来应对这些挑战，通过提供可重复的大规模数据和高效的估计方法。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the possible consequences of using satellite remote sensing techniques in estimating crop biomass compared to traditional field measurements?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用卫星遥感技术估算作物生物量与传统田间测量相比，可能会产生哪些后果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Satellite remote sensing techniques provide valuable information on vegetation parameters with high spatial coverage and long time series, which effectively compensates for the deficiency of traditional biomass estimation methods. This allows for a repeatable and comprehensive understanding at regional or larger scales, which is not possible with ground measurements alone.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 卫星遥感技术提供了关于植被参数的宝贵信息，具有高空间覆盖率和长时间序列，有效弥补了传统生物量估算方法的不足。这使得在区域或更大尺度上进行可重复和全面的理解成为可能，而仅靠地面测量是无法实现的。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of using forward feature selection in the development of machine learning models for biomass estimation?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在生物量估计的机器学习模型开发中使用前向特征选择的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using forward feature selection helps in identifying the most influential variables for the development of machine learning models, improving model performance by iteratively adding features that best enhance the model. This method ensures the creation of more accurate and efficient models, as seen in the improved performance of models like XGBoost and RF in estimating corn biomass.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用前向特征选择有助于识别对机器学习模型开发最具影响力的变量，通过迭代添加最佳增强模型的特征来提高模型性能。这种方法确保了创建更准确和高效的模型，正如在估计玉米生物量时，XGBoost和随机森林等模型的性能得到了改善。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to integrate ground-based measurements with satellite remote sensing data in the monitoring of crop biomass?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在作物生物量监测中，将地面测量与卫星遥感数据相结合的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Integrating ground-based measurements with satellite remote sensing data is important because it provides comprehensive information on vegetation parameters, ensuring high spatial coverage and long time series. This approach effectively compensates for the limitations of traditional biomass estimation methods, which cannot provide a comprehensive understanding at regional or larger scales.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 将地面测量与卫星遥感数据相结合是重要的，因为它提供了关于植被参数的全面信息，确保了高空间覆盖率和长期时间序列。这种方法有效弥补了传统生物量估算方法的局限性，后者无法在区域或更大尺度上提供全面的理解。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives of conducting field surveys and selecting sample sites for biomass observation in agricultural studies?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在农业研究中，进行实地调查和选择样本地点以观察生物量的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives of conducting field surveys and selecting sample sites for biomass observation are to obtain accurate and reliable data on crop biomass, which can be used to train and validate predictive models. This data collection method helps to ensure that the selected sample sites are representative of the larger area being studied, facilitating the development of models that can be generalized to regional scales.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 进行实地调查和选择生物量观察样本地点的目标是获取关于作物生物量的准确可靠数据，这些数据可以用于训练和验证预测模型。这种数据收集方法有助于确保所选样本地点能够代表所研究的更大区域，从而促进可以推广到区域尺度的模型的开发。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the steps involved in collecting and measuring corn biomass using ground observation techniques in agricultural research?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在农业研究中使用地面观测技术收集和测量玉米生物质涉及哪些步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The process involves selecting sample sites and plots for biomass observation, collecting all selected plants in each plot, washing the roots, measuring the fresh weight, transporting the plants to the laboratory, chopping them into easy-to-dry segments, and drying them in an oven at 85°C for 48–72 hours until a constant dry biomass is obtained.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该过程包括选择样本地点和生物量观察的样地，收集每个样地中所有选定的植物，清洗根部，测量鲜重，将植物运输到实验室，切割成易于干燥的段，然后在85°C的烘箱中干燥48-72小时，直到获得恒定的干生物量。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is vegetation cover percentage determined using digital camera methods during field observations?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何在实地观察中使用数字相机方法确定植被覆盖百分比？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Vegetation cover percentage is determined by using a digital camera to capture images of the target area. These images are then analyzed to quantify the percentage of ground covered by vegetation, providing a measure of vegetation density and distribution.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 植被覆盖百分比是通过使用数码相机捕捉目标区域的图像来确定的。这些图像随后被分析，以量化地面被植被覆盖的百分比，从而提供植被密度和分布的测量。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What machine learning techniques are utilized to estimate crop biomass from satellite remote sensing data, and what is the process for selecting influential variables?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 用于从卫星遥感数据估计作物生物量的机器学习技术有哪些，以及选择影响变量的过程是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Machine learning techniques such as random forest (RF), support vector machine (SVM), artificial neural network (ANN), and extreme gradient boosting (XGBoost) are used to estimate crop biomass. The forward feature selection method is implemented to choose the most influential variables, starting from no model features and iteratively adding the feature that best improves the model until no further improvement is made.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 机器学习技术，如随机森林（RF）、支持向量机（SVM）、人工神经网络（ANN）和极端梯度提升（XGBoost），被用于估计作物生物量。前向特征选择方法被实施以选择最具影响力的变量，从没有模型特征开始，迭代地添加最能改善模型的特征，直到不再有进一步的改善。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or technologies enable the accurate estimation of crop biomass using remote sensing techniques?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件或技术能够通过遥感技术准确估算作物生物量？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Satellite remote sensing techniques enable the accurate estimation of crop biomass by providing valuable information on vegetation parameters with high spatial coverage and long time series, which effectively compensates for the deficiencies of traditional biomass estimation methods.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 卫星遥感技术通过提供高空间覆盖率和长时间序列的植被参数信息，使得作物生物量的准确估计成为可能，有效弥补了传统生物量估计方法的不足。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methodologies or conditions enable the collection of continuous ground observation data for crop growth analysis during a growing season?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法或条件能够在生长季节内收集连续的地面观测数据，以进行作物生长分析？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Continuous ground observation data for crop growth analysis during a growing season is enabled by a combination of methodologies such as using digital cameras for vegetation coverage, LAI 2200 for leaf area index, and manual measurement tools like tape measures for plant height, conducted systematically over multiple observation periods.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 连续的地面观测数据用于作物生长分析，得益于多种方法的结合，例如使用数码相机进行植被覆盖度的测量、使用LAI 2200测量叶面积指数，以及使用卷尺等手动测量工具进行植物高度的测量，这些观测是在多个观察周期内系统地进行的。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might remote sensing techniques be expected to improve the efficiency of crop biomass estimation compared to traditional field measurement methods?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 与传统的田间测量方法相比，为什么遥感技术可能会提高作物生物量估算的效率？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Remote sensing techniques offer high spatial coverage and long time series data, allowing for repeatable and comprehensive monitoring of vegetation parameters, which effectively compensates for the labor-intensive and time-consuming nature of traditional field measurement methods.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 遥感技术提供了高空间覆盖率和长期时间序列数据，能够对植被参数进行可重复和全面的监测，有效弥补了传统实地测量方法的劳动密集和耗时特性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might it be challenging to acquire regional crop biomass estimates using only ground measurements?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 仅使用地面测量获取区域作物生物量估计可能面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Ground measurements are labor-intensive and time-consuming, and their sparse nature makes it difficult to provide comprehensive understanding at regional or larger scales, necessitating the use of remote sensing or other methods to achieve regional estimates.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 地面测量工作劳动密集且耗时，其稀疏性使得在区域或更大尺度上提供全面理解变得困难，因此需要使用遥感或其他方法来实现区域估算。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective do you think data collection methods using digital cameras, LAI meters, and measuring tapes are in capturing the biophysical properties of crops compared to satellite remote sensing techniques?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我认为使用数码相机、LAI仪和测量带的数据收集方法在捕捉作物的生物物理特性方面，与卫星遥感技术相比，效果如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data collection methods using digital cameras, LAI meters, and measuring tapes are relatively accurate for capturing biophysical properties of crops at a localized level. However, they are labor-intensive and time-consuming, making them less efficient for regional coverage. In contrast, satellite remote sensing techniques provide high spatial coverage and long time series data, effectively compensating for the deficiencies of traditional methods by providing valuable information on vegetation parameters at a larger scale.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 使用数码相机、LAI仪和测量带的数据收集方法在局部层面上相对准确地捕捉作物的生物物理特性。然而，这些方法劳动密集且耗时，使其在区域覆盖方面效率较低。相比之下，卫星遥感技术提供了高空间覆盖率和长期时间序列数据，有效弥补了传统方法的不足，为更大范围内的植被参数提供了有价值的信息。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the potential for MODIS datasets to be used in long-term crop biomass monitoring, considering spatial resolution and data availability?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您如何评价MODIS数据集在长期作物生物量监测中的潜力，考虑到空间分辨率和数据可用性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: MODIS datasets hold significant potential for long-term crop biomass monitoring due to their ability to provide consistent, repeatable observations over large areas with a 500 m spatial resolution. Their availability over extended periods allows for the analysis of temporal trends and patterns in crop biomass. However, the spatial resolution might limit the detection of fine-scale variations, and complementary ground observations are necessary to validate and refine the estimates obtained from MODIS data.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: MODIS 数据集由于能够在大范围内提供一致、可重复的观测，具有长期作物生物量监测的显著潜力，空间分辨率为 500 米。它们在较长时间内的可用性使得分析作物生物量的时间趋势和模式成为可能。然而，空间分辨率可能限制对细微变化的检测，因此需要补充的地面观测来验证和完善从 MODIS 数据中获得的估计值。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how the use of digital cameras for vegetation coverage measurement compares to other methods for data accuracy and efficiency.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解使用数码相机测量植被覆盖与其他方法在数据准确性和效率方面的比较。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The use of digital cameras for measuring vegetation coverage involves capturing images and analyzing them to determine the percentage of coverage. It is a non-destructive and relatively quick method compared to traditional techniques. However, the accuracy can vary depending on the resolution of the camera and the methodology applied in image analysis.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 使用数码相机测量植被覆盖度涉及捕捉图像并进行分析，以确定覆盖百分比。这是一种非破坏性且相对快速的方法，与传统技术相比。然而，准确性可能会因相机的分辨率和图像分析中应用的方法而有所不同。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential improvements in data collection methods for estimating crop biomass using a combination of ground observations and remote sensing technologies.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨通过结合地面观测和遥感技术来估算作物生物量的数据收集方法的潜在改进。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The current data collection method for estimating crop biomass involves ground-based observations and remote sensing technologies like MODIS datasets. Improvements could include integrating more advanced sensors for higher resolution data, employing UAVs for aerial imagery, or using additional satellite data to enhance temporal and spatial coverage. These methods can increase the accuracy and efficiency of biomass estimation by providing more comprehensive and detailed datasets.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 当前估算作物生物量的数据收集方法包括地面观察和遥感技术，如MODIS数据集。改进措施可以包括整合更先进的传感器以获取更高分辨率的数据，采用无人机进行空中影像拍摄，或使用其他卫星数据以增强时间和空间覆盖。这些方法可以通过提供更全面和详细的数据集来提高生物量估算的准确性和效率。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please propose strategies for enhancing dataset availability and quality for crop biomass estimation in the context of the Heihe River basin's agricultural landscape.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提出增强黑河流域农业景观中作物生物量估计的数据集可用性和质量的策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: To enhance dataset availability and quality for crop biomass estimation, strategies could include expanding the number of observation sites and plots, ensuring a diverse representation of different crop growth conditions. Collaborations with remote sensing agencies to access additional satellite data can improve spatial and temporal resolution. Implementing automated data collection techniques through IoT sensors and drones could provide real-time data, while machine learning can be utilized to refine and validate datasets, ensuring higher accuracy and reliability.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 为了提高作物生物量估计的数据集可用性和质量，可以采取以下策略：扩大观测站和样地的数量，确保不同作物生长条件的多样性代表。与遥感机构合作以获取额外的卫星数据，可以提高空间和时间分辨率。通过物联网传感器和无人机实施自动数据收集技术，可以提供实时数据，而机器学习可以用于精炼和验证数据集，确保更高的准确性和可靠性。
